column4: I have a problem. After logging in, the desktop comes up but without the menu bar. I have a mouse cursor, and I have wallpaper and  ctrl + alt + delete works. The "Help" button on the "restart the computer" menu brings up the help window but without the title bar. But that's all I can get to. Alt + F2 doesn't work. Has anyone else run into anything like this?
yes, there's a fix to that one, google it
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=837984
I suggest you goggle these terms: "ubuntu menu bar disappeared", one of the threads I found helped me fix my desktop
so you don't have a panel at all right now?
when you click on ALT-F2, you dont get a window where you can put in a command?
go to to a console and type metacity --replace
boot up in falsafe and try it again
were getting somewhere, backup your xorg.conf and reconfigure your xserver:  sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
I dont know what that is about but usually if you choose the defaults you should be good
you want to talk to a guru, you have to come back when someone like DrWillis is around
sounds like your bug and socratees bug should be sent in to the developers
your luck just got better Dr_Willis is in the house
you have to type the name first, as in the first few letters, then tab it, if he's using xchat he'll see it red and he'll know it's addressed to him

there are other gurus that come in the room every now and then so don't despair, just try different times, it's night time most of America, maybe some europeans will log in when it's night time in their time zone
K
ask your question again, maybe fccf can help you, if not hopefully someone else later on can
just for kicks create another user and see what happens
How do I create another user w/out the GUI?
try what Peddy is suggesting first, if you still cant resolve your problem then just goggle on how to add/remove users using the command line
ok
dont capitalize his nick, nobody likes that, instead type the first few letters of his nick, tab it and use the nick exactly as it appears
